16f7a02c-4449-4e60-96c6-76673b709d25.description: The earner of this badge is registered on Engineers Australia National Engineering Register in the category Professional Engineer. Registrants on the NER have been assessed as competent to practice independently and have demonstrated a commitment to their education, professional development, and ethical practice.
16f7a02c-4449-4e60-96c6-76673b709d25.name: National Engineering Register

badge_template_activities.title: The NER registrant has demonstrated technical competence in the area(s) of practice described in the "Evidence" section of this badge.
The NER registrant holds an accredited 4 years Bachelor Degree in Engineering, or has been assessed by Engineers Australia as having qualifications of a comparable standard and level.

The NER registrant has demonstrated 5 years of relevant work experience at the level of a Professional Engineer. (Exceptions apply for holders of credentials at a higher level) (See Work Experience Statement Guidelines)

NER registrants are committed to meet professional development requirement, corresponding to at least 150 hours of relevant professional development activities over the last 3 years of their career. (See CPD types and Conditions)

NER registrants have been assessed as competent to the expected standard of an independent practitioner. The registrant is assessed against five competencies: Deal with Ethical Issues, Practice Competently, Develop Safe and Sustainable Solutions, Identify & Manage Risks and Local Engineering Knowledge.
NER registrants are committed to ethical practice and are bound to abide by Engineers Australia's Code of Ethics
The NER registration is subject to be renewed annually, and is valid as long as the registrant meets audit and CPD requirements.
NER registrants are entitled to use the postnominal NER after their name.

d1d81eb7-de4d-475e-b19c-cc8ab7676015.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Starting in the Australian Engineering Workplace” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge have developed skills to perform in the workplace and know how to proactively manage their workload, document engineering work, make sound decisions based on ethical, legal and regulatory guidance, and communicate with stakeholders about project changes.
d1d81eb7-de4d-475e-b19c-cc8ab7676015.name: Starting in the Australian Engineering Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

a82b669f-563d-4f65-9d40-4a9b848561e3.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Fundamentals of Geotechnical Engineering” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge understand how geotechnical engineers scope, investigate and assess soil parameters, and report on their findings. They have developed a basic understanding of different soil and rock types and why site-specific investigations are essential for safe and sustainable engineering designs.
a82b669f-563d-4f65-9d40-4a9b848561e3.name: Fundamentals of Geotechnical Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

0c59b6d4-1da7-4da4-907d-a8efa63e8c8f.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “AS/NZS 3000 – The Wiring Rules” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge understand the core electrical safety concepts in the AS/NZS 3000 – The Wiring Rules standard and related standards, and can use several methods to ensure safety when designing electrical solutions.
0c59b6d4-1da7-4da4-907d-a8efa63e8c8f.name: AS/NZS 3000 – The Wiring Rules

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

6cc7da97-a146-48f8-bc67-4615bb3beb7e.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Safety in Design” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge understand the legal obligations of a designer under WHS/OHS legislation and some tools and techniques used to avoid major risks and failures in designs.
6cc7da97-a146-48f8-bc67-4615bb3beb7e.name: Safety in Design

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

a5dfc8cb-c406-4b93-a5d0-fc85217f7cfb.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Introduction to Rail Engineering” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge have gained a basic understanding of the role of an engineer in the design, maintenance and construction of rail services, and how these services can affect a wide range of construction projects and operations.
a5dfc8cb-c406-4b93-a5d0-fc85217f7cfb.name: Introduction to Rail Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

f1ba00d8-a33e-4abf-8de8-bd664e89d00b.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Contract Foundations” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. During this course, participants learnt the basics of how to properly prepare and manage a contract and understand their legal rights, responsibilities and obligations under a typical contract.
f1ba00d8-a33e-4abf-8de8-bd664e89d00b.name: Contract Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

7042121f-c196-481c-a420-2f6ab10745df.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Solar Power System Fundamentals” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge can apply an understanding of the different solar technologies to choose the right solar photovoltaic (PV) system to meet a site's specific needs, and are able to estimate the system's performance, costs and potential savings.
7042121f-c196-481c-a420-2f6ab10745df.name: Solar Power System Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

3ad27e0f-52ec-4784-b72f-e67dacf98a7d.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Concrete Technology for Civil Engineering” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge have gained practical knowledge on the design, production and placement of concrete from raw materials through to verification. They also understand the fundamentals of special applications including practice shotcrete, tremie concrete for piles, and self-compacting concrete.
3ad27e0f-52ec-4784-b72f-e67dacf98a7d.name: Concrete Technology for Civil Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

b28812fe-6263-4236-a69b-89a1f98cefa2.description: Engineers Australia’s Graduate Program gives graduates the many skills they need to thrive as engineers while showing them how to continue developing these skills independently into the future. Designed in consultation with engineering organisations, this engaging and flexible 18-month program helps new engineers develop the skills to achieve business results. Content within the program aligns to the underpinning knowledge engineers need to start their journey towards Chartered status.
b28812fe-6263-4236-a69b-89a1f98cefa2.name: Engineers Australia Graduate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Personal Empowerment module
Project Management module
Professional Skills module

da201c58-699c-43fd-a428-65fdbd33c738.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Risk in Engineering” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge can apply the best practice techniques required to manage risk for projects, operational processes, and the workplace. They know how to select the right tools for a situation, reduce risk by applying practical mitigation strategies, improve processes and frameworks, and can communicate effectively about risk.
da201c58-699c-43fd-a428-65fdbd33c738.name: Risk in Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

42922ab5-3562-4d5f-840c-99ffc3ea46ae.description: The earner of this badge has completed “The Engineering and Design Lifecycle” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge understand the phases of the engineering and design lifecycle and their role within it. They are able to manage broad and sometimes conflicting requirements for designs with this knowledge, as well as improve safety and efficiency outcomes and communication with stakeholders.
42922ab5-3562-4d5f-840c-99ffc3ea46ae.name: The Engineering and Design Lifecycle

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

d9c6f392-6d1c-4d14-9bf1-06e9e87f7104.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Introduction to the Building Code of Australia” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge have learnt how to interpret the Building Code of Australia (BCA) and its role in the design and construction of buildings. They are able to apply relevant BCA resources to projects and are better informed to discuss the BCA with building certifiers and other stakeholders.
d9c6f392-6d1c-4d14-9bf1-06e9e87f7104.name: Introduction to the Building Code of Australia

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

cfcfbfad-7111-44df-a079-c4fb23efb713.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Project Planning, Scheduling and Control” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge can apply project planning, scheduling and control practices to improve project performance. They know how to establish a baseline for a project, manage change and report on performance, and use risk management tools and techniques to improve decision making.
cfcfbfad-7111-44df-a079-c4fb23efb713.name: Project Planning, Scheduling and Control

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

d488d385-92a7-4613-a0b6-54286baef821.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Systems Thinking in Engineering” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge understand the basics of systems engineering and can make better decisions when managing complex projects. They know the underpinning concepts of systems engineering, how to bring all the working parts together to manage complex projects, and tools for creating secure systems capabilities.
d488d385-92a7-4613-a0b6-54286baef821.name: Systems Thinking in Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

6aa3ed26-1abb-44bb-9242-26e9212ab46c.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Project Management Essentials” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge understand the fundamentals of project management including approaches, techniques, and tools with a focus on key themes around stakeholders, teams, and communication.
6aa3ed26-1abb-44bb-9242-26e9212ab46c.name: Project Management Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: 12-hour course including online self-study modules and live virtual workshops

f4326ed5-13f2-44f0-90e5-fb54536bf066.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Enhancing Project Performance” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge have learnt strategies to improve project success including monitoring and controlling a project, identifying the most effective tools and techniques, procurement and supply chain planning, communicating with stakeholders, and assessing and managing risk.
f4326ed5-13f2-44f0-90e5-fb54536bf066.name: Enhancing Project Performance

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

db935df2-4a0d-4492-8c1d-b944f5e361de.description: The earner of this badge has completed the “Solar Battery Storage” short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge know how to assess and compare the characteristics and performance of batteries for photovoltaic (PV) systems to meet the energy needs of residential or small commercial properties. They have also learnt about electrical and other hazards to avoid when handling, installing and disposing of battery systems.
db935df2-4a0d-4492-8c1d-b944f5e361de.name: Solar Battery Storage

badge_template_activities.title: 8-hour online course

c5b84d6c-856c-4711-ad00-fb6651c23810.description: The earner of this badge has completed the AS5488 Subsurface Utility Engineering EEA Online course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge can describe the field of subsurface utility engineering and how its principles can be used to provide better information to design engineers that can in turn significantly reduce construction delays (and costs) and improve safety.
c5b84d6c-856c-4711-ad00-fb6651c23810.name: AS5488 Subsurface Utility Engineering

alignments.name: AS 5488.1:2019 Classification of subsurface utility information S (saiglobal.com)
alignments.description: Provides a framework for the classification of subsurface utility location and attributes information in terms of specified quality levels.

badge_template_activities.title: The latest release of AS5488 is a guide to how to best manage underground utilities. The course highlights the main sections of AS5488 and how they relate to being used on a project.

24de24b1-3d23-4ef9-9d28-837dba6e0d05.description: The earner of this badge has completed the Asset Maintenance and Reliability short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge can explain asset maintenance and reliability management and their benefits. They can identify equipment failures and failure characteristics, develop maintenance strategies using reliability engineering principles, and when to use FMECA and RCM processes.
24de24b1-3d23-4ef9-9d28-837dba6e0d05.name: Asset Maintenance and Reliability

badge_template_activities.title: Learn how to create an environment whereby your maintenance and reliability strategies can adapt to the changing lifecycle needs of your assets without compromising safety, environmental and business goals, and objectives. Learn how asset maintenance and reliability can become an integral part of your asset management system. Learn how to use the building blocks of a 4th generation asset maintenance and reliability system, and to adapt to the changing needs of your organisation’s assets.

01943f86-af8b-4464-bf26-33146717dd6a.description: An Engineers Australia micro-credential represents the attainment of one (or more) elements of competency from the EA credential Chartered. The badge means that the holder develops and operates within a hazard and risk framework appropriate to engineering activities.
01943f86-af8b-4464-bf26-33146717dd6a.name: Identify, Assess and Manage Risk

alignments.name: Chartered (Stage 2) Competency for Engineers
alignments.description: The Chartered Competency Standards are the profession's expression of the knowledge and skill base, engineering application abilities, and professional skills, values and attitudes that must be demonstrated in order to practise independently or unsupervised. This standard is based upon the International Engineering Alliance Standards.

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder has completed an online learning course that required them to demonstrate an understanding of the International Standards for Risk Management and tools fr the analysis of risk.
The badge holder has attended and participated in a virtual workshop.  This included completing collaborative risk management activities and discussions with their peers on risk.
The badge holder has participated in a coaching session with a Chartered Engineer.
The badge holder has submitted a portfolio of risk management documents, which has been assessed at the Chartered level.

a27123d0-82da-45b3-802a-9b8faa69f9d9.description: An Engineers Australia micro-credential represents the attainment of one (or more) elements of competency from the EA credential of Chartered. This badge demonstrates the attainment of the 'Deal with ethical situations' competency which means holders anticipate the consequences of intended action or inaction and understand how those consequences are managed. It means holders demonstrate an ability to identify ethical issues when they arise and to act appropriately.
a27123d0-82da-45b3-802a-9b8faa69f9d9.name: Deal with ethical situations

alignments.name: Chartered
alignments.description: The Chartered Competency Standards are the profession's expression of the knowledge and skill base, engineering application abilities, and professional skills, values and attitudes that must be demonstrated in order to practise independently or unsupervised. This standard is based on the International Engineering Alliance Standards.

alignments.name: Chartered
alignments.description: The Chartered Competency Standards are the profession's expression of the knowledge and skill base, engineering application abilities, and professional skills, values and attitudes that must be demonstrated in order to practise independently or unsupervised. This standard is based on the International Engineering Alliance Standards.

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder has attended a virtual workshop and discussed ethical dilemmas and their resolution. They demonstrated their ability to resolve ethical dilemmas.
The badge holder has completed online learning activities related to ethical awareness.
The badge holder has participated in a coaching session with a Chartered Engineer.
The badge holder has submitted a career episode report that has been assessed as being at the Chartered level of competence.

03e59ac1-4f11-4235-923e-e7e9e7cb29fe.description: The earner of this badge has completed the Lean Construction Fundamentals short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge understand the concepts of lean and waste in the context of the construction industry. They know about common lean tools including the Last Planner System®, can identify typical problems and solutions, can and develop basic performance metrics that support lean implementation on construction projects.
03e59ac1-4f11-4235-923e-e7e9e7cb29fe.name: Lean Construction Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: This Lean Construction Fundamentals course aims to build your knowledge of lean thinking, which can be applied to work in the construction industry. Lean thinking is driving change within all industry sectors in the modern economy however the construction industry is a late adopter of these ideas. Lean organisations are outperforming their competitors based on measurable performance criteria. Lean is focused on maximising the value that service providers give to their customers.

548fc9b8-1f63-40a3-95f6-ae9753c3553e.description: The earner of this badge has completed the Construction Tenders and Bids short course delivered by Engineers Australia’s training provider, Engineering Education Australia. Earners of this badge understand the tasks involved in a formal tendering process and can contribute to a bid or tender for new work in the construction industry.
548fc9b8-1f63-40a3-95f6-ae9753c3553e.name: Construction Tenders and Bids

badge_template_activities.title: This course enables you describes the process of submitting a tender response and what goes into it. It covers a contract’s terms and conditions and the competencies of the various members of a bid team. It will help you to facilitate a risk assessment workshop and complete a go/no go assessment, including how to identify things that result in a project failure. By the end of this course, you will be able to prepare the scope of work, schedule, work breakdown structure and resource plans.

5276d3f6-2337-4b24-9b10-3cc79141fd22.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the assessment requirements for the Risk Management Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge demonstrate that they apply the best practice techniques required to manage risk for projects, operational processes, and the workplace. They know how to select the right tools for a situation, reduce risk by applying practical mitigation strategies, improve processes and frameworks, and can communicate effectively about risk.
5276d3f6-2337-4b24-9b10-3cc79141fd22.name: Risk Management Micro-credential

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.
Demonstrated Risk Management practices to an agreed standard of practice which align with Engineers Australia's Chartered outcomes.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for Risk Management.
Risk Management

669e3188-c0f5-47c9-947b-65408afbcf8a.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the assessment requirements for the Ethical Practice Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. This badge demonstrates the earners’ ability to anticipate consequences of intended action or inaction and understand how those consequences are managed. They can identify ethical issues as they arise and act appropriately. They know the right tools to select, improve processes and frameworks, and can communicate effectively about ethics.
669e3188-c0f5-47c9-947b-65408afbcf8a.name: Ethical Practice Micro-credential

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.
Demonstrated Ethical practices to an agreed Engineers Australia standard of practice.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for Ethical practice.
Ethical Practice

e85ca9be-dc78-4083-998b-bbaea5b1b807.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the assessment requirements for the Develop Rail Track Alignment Design Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge have demonstrated that they can apply the best practice techniques required to; Develop a fit for purpose (including safe and sustainable) mainline track alignment design and Coordinate rail track design with other disciplines.
e85ca9be-dc78-4083-998b-bbaea5b1b807.name: Develop Rail Track Alignment Design Micro-credential

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.
Demonstrated rail track design practices to an agreed standard of practice via Engineers Australia's Rail Track Specialisation.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for Develop Rail Track Alignment Design.
Develop Rail Track Alignment Design

62837c31-cd3d-4c13-854e-64db20881c57.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the assessment requirements for the Communication Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge have demonstrated they can apply best practice techniques required to communicate to a diverse range of stakeholders regarding projects, operational processes, and workplace procedures. They can build positive relationships based on respect and trust, and determine suitable communications styles appropriate for various audiences.
62837c31-cd3d-4c13-854e-64db20881c57.name: Communication Micro-credential

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.
Demonstrated professional skills which align to the Engineer's Australia standard of practice for Communication.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for Communication.
Communication

skills.name: Ensures confidentiality and privacy of information

eb83d9f0-8afd-4244-be5a-1d820b75adbb.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the Construction Contract Management Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge have demonstrated that, as a project engineer, they can manage contracts specifically in the construction sector. They know how to read and interpret a contract, and understand commercial principles and their rights and obligations within a contract.
eb83d9f0-8afd-4244-be5a-1d820b75adbb.name: Construction Contract Management

alignments.name: Construction Engineer Learning and Development Guide

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.

Demonstrated contract management practices to an agreed standard of practice via the Construction Engineer Learning and Development Guide developed by Engineers Australia and the Australian Constructors Association.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for Contract management.
Construction Contract Management

ab658990-c265-4724-996b-b803a21b3ba5.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the Manage Construction Project Costs Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge have demonstrated that, as a project engineer, they can forecast, manage and track project budgets and costs in a construction context. They know how to check quantum of scope, use technology to manage costs, and communicate budgets and work packages to construction crews.
ab658990-c265-4724-996b-b803a21b3ba5.name: Construction Manage Project Costs

alignments.name: Construction Engineer Learning and Development Guide

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.

Demonstrated project cost management practices to an agreed standard of practice via the Construction Engineer Learning and Development Guide developed by Engineers Australia and the Australian Constructors Association.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for manage project cost.
Manage project cost

8cb639d0-c819-4fbe-81ed-b6b4eb4faa8f.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the Manage Construction Project Schedule Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge have demonstrated that, as a project engineer, they can design, manage and report on project schedules in a construction context. They know how to schedule a scope of work, can relate the schedule back to costs, and understand the commercial implications and impact of any changes.
8cb639d0-c819-4fbe-81ed-b6b4eb4faa8f.name: Construction Manage Project Schedule

alignments.name: Construction Engineer Learning and Development Guide

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.

Demonstrate project schedule management practices to an agreed standard of practice via the Construction Engineer Learning and Development Guide developed by Engineers Australia and the Australian Constructors Association.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for Manage Construction Project Schedule.
Construction Manage Project Schedule

1e6f5859-1725-4244-b3ee-b0b053a7845a.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the Manage Construction Tenders and Bids Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge have demonstrated that, as a project engineer, they can apply best practice techniques to prepare, evaluate, and coordinate bids and tenders in a construction context.
1e6f5859-1725-4244-b3ee-b0b053a7845a.name: Construction Manage Tenders and Bids

alignments.name: Construction Engeer Learning and Development Guide

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.

Demonstrate managing tender and bid practices to an agreed standard of practice via the Construction Engineer Learning and Development Guide developed by Engineers Australia and the Australian Constructors Association.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for managing tenders and bids.
Construction Manage tenders and bids

591ac63a-cbc5-47b4-8fbb-b530f0e373c4.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the assessment requirements for the Develop Rail Track Alignment Design Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge have demonstrated that they can apply the best practice techniques required to develop a fit for purpose (including safe and sustainable) mainline track alignment design, and coordinate rail track design with other disciplines.
591ac63a-cbc5-47b4-8fbb-b530f0e373c4.name: Determine Rail Track Design Requirements Micro-credential

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.
Demonstrated rail track design practices to an agreed standard of practice via Engineers Australia's Rail Track Specialisation.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for determining design requirements for Rail Track.
Determine Rail Track Design Requirements Criteria

dbae754d-025d-4d4c-8e1d-3f843bc98d7e.description: Equips non-digital engineering (DE) professionals with the knowledge to engage with DE practice from an informed position, identify where DE can improve project and business performance, and understand the potential challenges and pitfalls. Provides a fundamental understanding of the application of Digital Engineering (DE) to the delivery and operation of the built environment, from project inception, design and engineering, procurement, and construction delivery, through to operations. The ea
dbae754d-025d-4d4c-8e1d-3f843bc98d7e.name: Introduction to Digital Engineering for the Built Environment

badge_template_activities.title: This 8-hour online course provides participants with a fundamental awareness of the application of Digital Engineering (DE) to the delivery and operation of the built environment. DE concepts including Computer-Aided Design, Building Information Modelling, Geographic Information Systems, Information Management, and Survey and Reality Capture are discussed. Key standards are introduced. Common processes and emerging technologies and trends are also discussed.

skills.name: Application of digital engineering in the built environment

829e9817-ef6a-4eb3-85ba-066ab12d9c4c.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the Plan Rail Track Construction Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge have demonstrated that they can apply best practice techniques required to; develop a documented rail track construction plan, develop plans to coordinate materials, human resources, equipment and other required plant for a rail track construction project, and/or occupations.
829e9817-ef6a-4eb3-85ba-066ab12d9c4c.name: Plan Rail Track Construction Micro-credential

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.
Demonstrated Plan Rail Track Construction practices to an agreed standard of practice via Engineers Australia's Rail Track Specialisation.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for Plan Rail Track Construction works for Rail Track.
Plan Rail Track Construction Works

e3b84e60-db9d-470a-803d-c1ae84307995.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed requirements for the Scope and Commission Rail Track Maintenance Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners have demonstrated best practice techniques required to develop rail track maintenance plans, prepare contract and tender documents, evaluate maintenance contract submissions, monitor the engagement and conduct of maintenance works, inspect and evaluate a section of track and document the condition of the track and formation.
e3b84e60-db9d-470a-803d-c1ae84307995.name: Scope and Commission Rail Track Maintenance Micro-credential

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.
Demonstrated rail track scope and commission maintenance practices to an agreed standard of practice via Engineers Australia's Rail Track Specialisation.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for scope and commission maintenance requirements for Rail Track.
Scope and Commission Rail Track Maintenance

f737a8a5-53c3-49b3-b39b-9d53ec8a0c43.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the assessment requirements for the Stakeholder Engagement Micro-credential from Engineers Australia. Earners of this badge have demonstrated that they can apply the best practice techniques required to identify, engage and manage stakeholders for projects, operational processes, and the workplace.
f737a8a5-53c3-49b3-b39b-9d53ec8a0c43.name: Stakeholder Engagement Micro-credential

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has been assessed via a comprehensive professional portfolio submission including examples of practice and reflection via interview aligned to the Engineers Australia industry standard of practice.
Demonstrated stakeholder engagement practices to an agreed standard of practice aligned to Engineers Australia's Chartered outcomes.
Provided a body of evidence that demonstrated skills, knowledge and applied practice to industry-validated criteria for stakeholder engagement.
Stakeholder Engagement
